eab607b6-60df-4678-9f3d-7818b83ba429.description: EPIC members who complete this course understand how to use semiotics to create and communicate meaning by developing compelling, culturally relevant strategies that ensure our products, processes and organizations resonate more deeply with people. Participants gain a foundation in semiotic theory, principles and methods, and the application of semiotics and cultural insight to different commercial and industry challenges.
eab607b6-60df-4678-9f3d-7818b83ba429.name: Semiotics: A User's Guide to Seeing Differently

badge_template_activities.title: Completed coursework includes lectures, readings, exercises, and a case study project that build Participants complete a field and case study assignment, using applied learning from the course. Participants apply with core models, work through a live case study on a cultural theme, and learn to develop culturally sensitive strategies across global geographies.

d7701062-b1da-47d2-a0aa-c19b628c61a3.description: EPIC members who complete this 8-week course have learned to design effective projects and a high-quality, strategic research practice to guide innovation. The course covers the selection of methods and frameworks for building a robust, adaptive research rationale; time management; stakeholder engagement; organizational challenges to research and impact; and quality frameworks.
d7701062-b1da-47d2-a0aa-c19b628c61a3.name: Ethnographic Research Design and Innovation

badge_template_activities.title: Coursework  includes live, online sessions; exercises and readings completed independently; a capstone project and presentation; and office hours. Participants develop and present a research design plan using techniques learned in the course, which is evaluated by the instructor.

e0c9608e-8632-47b4-82bb-d37cec403ccd.description: EPIC Members who complete this 6-week course have learned how to use core models of society and culture to create better research, deeper insights, and greater value for organizations and communities. They covered a range of sociocultural theories that illuminate connections among people, places, and material or technological systems. Participants also worked through case studies to practice theory in product and service design, consumer insights, UX, market research, strategy, and more.
e0c9608e-8632-47b4-82bb-d37cec403ccd.name: Using Theory in Research

badge_template_activities.title: Coursework includes 12 hours of live, online group sessions with the instructor; a private work session with the instructor; 4 hours of instructional videos; required readings and case studies; and optional text and video materials.

e479bbdc-66d4-43e6-bd34-2ee52d234f5b.description: EPIC members who complete this course build skills to catalyze change in their teams, organizations, or other professional environments. Participants model and evaluate their organizational and professional networks; learn insights from multi-disciplinary research; assess their skills and attributes as change agents, influencers, and communicators; learn about cognitive styles and strategic communications; and build concrete plans for increasing their impact.
e479bbdc-66d4-43e6-bd34-2ee52d234f5b.name: Maximizing Your Impact as a Change Agent

badge_template_activities.title: Required coursework includes live, online sessions; reading assignments; peer coaching; 1:1 coaching with the instructor; and independent writing and exercises. Participants learn and apply skills and attributes as change agents, influencers, and communicators, evaluating what it takes to be valuable and successful in the context of your own organizations or professional situations.

75d0a259-5161-41c6-a63c-c1c656328746.description: EPIC members who complete this 6-week course have learned to decode and leverage organizational culture to amplify the impact of their work. Participants learn core theories from anthropology and psychology to understand how culture frames behavior, as well as techniques for mapping and analyzing cultural dynamics to address concrete organizational and business challenges. They learn and practice strategies for maximizing impact with teams, clients, stakeholders and organizations.
75d0a259-5161-41c6-a63c-c1c656328746.name: Leveraging Organizational Culture for Impact

badge_template_activities.title: Coursework includes 10 hours of live, online instruction and group work, plus 17–20 hours of independent work, including lectures, readings, and technical exercises. Participants learn theories and frameworks, mapping and analysis techniques, and strategies for application to a variety of business challenges.

f575b95e-5dcc-4f9f-a0cc-afaeba5665a3.description: EPIC members who complete this 4-week course understand fundamentals of business finance, organization, and strategy, and have practiced using these tools to extend the scope and strategic impact of research and data.
f575b95e-5dcc-4f9f-a0cc-afaeba5665a3.name: Mini-MBA for Applied Social Scientists

badge_template_activities.title: Coursework includes live classes and discussions, readings, two substantial assignments, and instructor/peer critique. Through a hands-on case study methodology, participants diagnose a company’s business problem using financial data, organizational information, and strategic documents; then design and present their own research plans for how to address the business problem and how to engage key stakeholders to ensure the greatest impact.

4cdd3d58-0749-47c6-9267-3625d69e4fe5.description: EPIC members who complete this 6-week course have learned a powerful toolkit of observational research techniques and interpretive frameworks for projects in human-centered research, design, and innovation. Participants learn and apply this toolkit to a concrete business challenge by creating a robust research plan and a rationale for the investment. The course also covers ethics, integration of observation into mixed-methods projects, and applications in both physical and digital environments.
4cdd3d58-0749-47c6-9267-3625d69e4fe5.name: Observation in Ethnographic Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Coursework includes 14 hours of live, online work sessions, and independent weekly assignments with research exercises, readings, and videos.

20ea48d7-f2cb-4c60-bdbf-e42aebc4bb51.description: EPIC members who complete this 5-week course understand how to decode and work with client cultures throughout projects and longer-term client relationships. Participants first learn how to use theories from anthropology and psychology to approach client relationships as an ethnographic space and then apply specific tools and strategies for key areas of the project journey, including meetings, cultural surveys, workshops, and other formal and informal interactions.
20ea48d7-f2cb-4c60-bdbf-e42aebc4bb51.name: Creating Impact with Projects and Clients: Leveraging Organizational Culture

badge_template_activities.title: Coursework includes 10 hours of live, online work sessions, and independent work including prerecorded lectures, readings, and exercises. Participants learn organizational theories and analytical tools; map and work through challenges in client relationships; develop techniques for workshops and meetings that address challenges faced with clients; and stage honest conversations to build trust.
